field.label: Reverse Proxy Domain
field.help: Select a reverse proxy domain, to which this handle should be added.

field.label: Reverse Proxy Subdomain
field.help: Optionally, select a reverse proxy subdomain, to which this handle should be added. In most cases, leaving this on "None" will be the best choice.

field.label: Handle Type
field.help: Select the handle type. In most cases, leaving this on handle will be the best choice.

field.label: Handle Path
field.help: Enter the handle, e.g. '/*' or '/example/*' or leave empty for a catch all handle. In most cases, leaving this empty will be the best choice.

field.label: Backend Server Domain
field.help: Enter the internal domain name or IP address to the backend server destination of this handle.

field.label: Backend Server Port
field.help: Enter the port number of the backend server. Leave this empty for bind to port 80. For HTTPS, use 443.

field.label: TLS
field.help: Use TLS over HTTP (HTTPS) to communicate with the Backend Server. In most cases, leaving this unchecked will be the best choice. Caddy uses HTTP for communication with the Backend Server by default.

field.label: TLS Trusted CA Certificate
field.help: If TLS is enabled, and you are not using a globally trusted server certificate on your Backend Server, you can choose a CA certificate to trust from System Trust Authorities.

field.label: NTLM
field.help: When "TLS" has been checked, check "NTLM" in addition for reverse proxying an Exchange Server. In most other cases, leaving this unchecked will be the best choice.

field.label: Description
field.help: Enter a description for this handle.
